_prev_prog_3.MS_OtherType: Fire monitors and onsite response team with suppression

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The TotalEnergies Port Arthur site refines oil to produce gasoline, diesel, jet fuel, and petrochemicals to be used as building blocks for other products





Process Description

This section includes a brief description of each of the covered processes and the covered chemicals included in the facility's RM Plan.  



ALKY Unit

The Alkylation (ALKY) unit's primary function is to produce a high octane "alkylate" product which boils in the aviation gasoline range by the chemical reaction of olefin hydrocarbons (usually normal and isobutylene) with isoparaffin (isobutane) in the presence of a catalyst.  The covered chemicals for this unit include a flammable mixture (C4 and lighter). 





ACU-1 and ACU-2 Unit

The Atmospheric Crude Unit (ACU) takes raw crude and fractionates it into five (5) different products which are sent to other units as feed or sold.  The covered chemicals for this unit include a flammable mixture (ethane, ethylene, hydrogen, methane, butane, pentane, propane, propylene, isobutene).





Coker Unit

The Delayed Coker Unit (DCU) upgrades low value residual feedstocks to higher value distillate products using the delayed coking process.   The covered chemicals for this unit include a flammable mixture (C5 and lighter). 



CNDS Unit

The Condensate Splitter (CNDS) unit is designed to separate Sleipner or Oso light crude condensates producing jet fuel, diesel, gas oil, heavy naphtha and light naphtha.  The covered chemicals for this unit include a flammable mixture (C6 and lighter). 

DHT-1 Unit

The Distillate Hydrotreater (DHT) unit is designed to achieve desulfurization and upgrade of the lighter components of the FCCU feed with reasonable cycle length.  The covered chemicals for this unit include a flammable mixture (C5 and lighter).



FCCU/OGT Unit

The Fluid Catalytic Cracking Unit (FCCU) and Off-Gas Treater (OGT) unit uses a catalyst to convert heavy hydrocarbons into lighter hydrocarbons.  The covered chemicals for this unit include a f

lammable mixture (C5 and lighter). 



GHT Unit

The Gasoline Hydrotreater (GHT) unit decreases the amount of sulfur in the process streams by increasing the amount of hydrogen in the product.  The covered chemicals for this unit include a flammable mixture (C5 and lighter). 



NHTR Unit

The Naphtha Hydrotreater Reformer (NHTR) unit continuously converts low octane naphtha to a high octane gasoline blending component.  The covered chemicals for this unit include a flammable mixture (hydrogen and C5 and lighter). 



ISOM Unit

The Isomerization Process (ISOM) unit is a steady state operation that converts normals to isomers in the presence of hydrogen via the utilization of Shell's HS-10 catalyst or the equivalent.  The covered chemicals for this unit include a flammable mixture (C5 and lighter).



SATS Unit

The Saturated Liquids Plant (SATS) unit's overall process is basically a fractionation process of liquid hydrocarbons, carried out under pressure in a series of fractionation and treating columns, with the separation first of the heavy fractions, then the lighter ones.  The covered chemicals for this unit include a flammable mixture (C5 and lighter).



LRU Unit

The Liquid Recovery Unit recovers LPG (liquefied petroleum gases) with a fixed mass fraction of methane from the gas feed mixture.  The covered chemicals for this unit include a flammable mixture (C5 and lighter).



OM&S Complex

Tank Farm

The tank farm unit is the main storage location of crude and refined products.  It consists of multiple large storage vessels.  The covered chemicals for this unit include flammable mixtures (C5 and lighter). 

RPC Complex



DEMEX Unit

The Demex unit's main objective is to extract from the vacuum tower bottoms a demetallized oil (DMO) of reasonable quality and by-products of resin and asphalt.  The covered chemicals for this unit include flammables (butane, isobutane, pentane, isopentane).





TotalEnergies Port Arthur refinery understands the hazards associa

ted with the use of covered chemicals and has an accidental release prevention plan in effect. This plan is based on the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) Plan. In its plan, OSHA details training requirements for employees and precautions to be taken in manufacturing and maintenance of equipment when using hazardous materials.





Emergency response is handled by refinery employees who are well trained in emergency response activities. If needed, the site also a member of the Sabine Neches Chiefs Mutual Aid Association. The Refinery utilizes and maintains Safer Systems monitors around the perimeter of the facility.



The site takes the planned changes to improve safety is to maintain and ensure operability of existing vent, alarm, interlock systems as well as maintaining its equipment to ensure its integrity
